tool_description: Analyzes building characteristics, dimensions, occupancy type, and structural features to establish baseline requirements for fire suppression system design.

building_type.description: Type of building (residential, commercial, industrial, warehouse, hospital, school, etc.)

floor_area.description: Total floor area in square feet

construction_type.description: Construction classification (Type I, Type II, Type III, Type IV, Type V)

error_messages: Invalid building type: Must be one of the recognized building classifications (residential, commercial, industrial, warehouse, hospital, school, office, retail, mixed-use).
Invalid floor area: Must be a positive number greater than 100 square feet.
Invalid building height: Must be a positive number between 8 and 2000 feet.
Invalid occupancy load: Must be a positive integer between 1 and 50000.
Invalid construction type: Must be Type I, Type II, Type III, Type IV, or Type V per building codes.
usage: Input the building's basic characteristics including type, dimensions, occupancy, and construction class. The tool will classify the building for fire protection requirements and identify key constraints for system design.

fire_area_divisions.description: List of fire area zones identified in the building

structural_constraints.description: Structural limitations that may affect system installation

assessment_summary.description: Overall assessment of building characteristics for fire protection
